required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Protein Requirements in Adults With Phenylketonuria (PKU)
clinical_study.official_title: Protein Requirements in Phenylketonuria (PKU) Patients Compared Using PKU Sphere™ | Glycomacropeptide (GMP) and an L-amino Acid-based Product

brief_summary.textblock: Phenylketonuria (PKU) is an inherited inborn error of phenylalanine (PHE) metabolism caused by decreased activity of phenylalanine hydroxylase (PAH) enzyme. Therefore, PHE accumulates in plasma leading to mental problems. Treatment is a phenylalanine-restricted diet with sufficient protein. However, the optimum protein requirements are still unknown and compliance with diet is not satisfactory in PKU adults. A Previously established technique called indicator amino acid oxidation (IAAO) will be used to determine protein requirements from amino acid based formula vs. glycomacropeptide (GMP) in adults with PKU (≥ 19y). This study will help treat adults with enough protein ensuring maintenance of health.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (1 study day). 3 samples will collected as a baseline prior to isotope protocol and 6 samples after 2 hours and 30 minutes of starting the tracer protocol. Data will be reported an average of 2 years.
primary_outcome.description: Breath samples will be collected during the study to measure the rate of oxidation of tracer in the expired breath.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (1 study day). 1 sample will collected as a baseline prior to isotope protocol and 2 samples after 2 hours and 30 minutes of starting the tracer protocol. Data will be reported an average of 2 years.
primary_outcome.description: Urine samples will be collected during the study to measure the flux enrichment in urine.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One sample (at 6th meal) after starting of the tracer protocol. Data will be reported an average of 2 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Phenylalanine concentrations will be measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One sample (at 6th meal) after starting of the tracer protocol. Data will be reported an average of 2 years.
secondary_outcome.description: Tyrosine concentrations will be measured in blood.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One sample (at 6th meal) after starting of the tracer protocol. Data will be reported an average of 2 years.
secondary_outcome.description: 16 other amino acids will be measured in blood.

intervention.description: Oral consumption of eight hourly experimental meals- -4 tracer free experimental meals containing a mixture of free amino acids and calories from protein free flavoured liquid, protein free cookies and corn oil -4 isotopically labeled experimental meals. The same protocol will be repeated with glycomacropeptide (GMP).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Adults more than 19 years of age who are diagnosed with PKU and clinically stable with no acute illness
Exclusion Criteria:
- Adults with PKU under age 19 year
- Adults diagnosed with PKU but are currently ill with a fever or cold

overall_official.affiliation: BC Children's Hospital Research Institute, University of British Columbia

facility.name: BC Children's Hospital Research Institute, University of British Columbia
